intro: Muehlenbeckia ribesioides, commonly known as the silver wattle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring slender, wiry stems covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Muehlenbeckia ribesioides is well adapted to coastal and maritime environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils.
